member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions
member.summary:
Contain extension methods for the Branch and Bound assignment matching algorithm.
See: Assignment Problem using Branch and Bound
See: Branch and Bound - An Assignment Problem
See: Branch and Bound

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.BranchingNode
member.summary: Branching node used internally.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.MatchAssigments(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary:
Gets the first optimal assignment matching where the provided cost matrix represents the cost between each (row, column) pair.
(Row, column) pairs represent the bipartite graph.
member.param: Cost matrix for each (row, column) pair where infinity costs represent disconnected vertexes.
member.returns:
Assignment matching matrix where true elements represent the pairing.
If a row or a column does not contain true value, the corresponding vertex (row/column) is not matched with any other vertex (column/row).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.matchAssigments(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary:
Gets the optimal assignment matching where the provided cost matrix represents the cost between each (row, column) pair.
(Row, column) pairs represent the bipartite graph.
member.param: Cost matrix for each (row, column) pair where infinity costs represent disconnected vertexes.
member.returns: The first best solution (terminal node that needs to be backtracked).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.branchAndSelectMinCostNodes(System.Double[0:,0:],Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.BranchingNode)
member.summary: Creates immediate child nodes for the specified node.
member.param: Node that needs to be branched.
member.returns: List of feasible immediate child nodes.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.makeNode(System.Double[0:,0:],Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.BranchingNode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Makes node by using the specified parent node and the child index (column in the cost matrix).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.findMinInRowOmmitingTaken(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Finds the minimum number inside the cost matrix committing columns that are already taken.
member.param: The row in the cost matrix.
The binary mask which tells which columns are taken (used by other nodes).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.BranchAndBoundAssigmentExtensions.createRoot(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Creates root node.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline
member.summary:
Represents cardinal cubic spline which is a type of C(1) interpolating spline made up of cubic polynomial segments.
See:
and
.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.MIN_INDEX
member.summary: Minimal point index of the cardinal spline.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.MAX_INDEX_OFFSET
member.summary: Offset from the maximal index.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.NUM_DERIVATIVE_POINTS
member.summary: Number of points which are used for interpolation.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates cardinal spline.
member.param: Adds first and last control point so that current border point can be also interpreted as part of a contour.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.ControlPoints
member.summary: Gets the total number of points.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.Tension
member.summary:
Tension.
Value 1 gives linear interpolation. Values smaller than 1 gives greater contour "exterior" tension. Values greater than 1 give greater contour "interior" tension.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.Count
member.summary:
Gets the total number of points.
The total number of points that can be used for interpolation is totalNumber -

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.InterpolateAt(System.Single)
member.summary: Interpolates four control points.

member.summary: Gets derivative at specified index.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.NormalAt(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets normal direction at specified point.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.Clone
member.summary: Clones this curvature. Curvature points are not shared.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.InterpolateAt(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Interpolates four control points.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.InterpolateAt(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Single})
member.summary: Interpolates points and defined indices.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.Interpolate(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Interpolates at indices which are obtained using .
Distances between points do not have to be equal because control points may not be equally distributed.
For equally distributed points please use: .

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.DerivativeAt(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets derivative at specified index.
member.param: Derivation in control point is zero. If true a small offset will be used to avoid zero-point result if a point is control point.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.NormalAt(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets normal direction at specified point.
member.param: If true a small offset will be used to avoid zero-point result if a point is control point.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.GetEqualyDistributedPointIndices(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary:
Gets indices for which points are evenly distributed along contour.
A rough estimation is made at resolution: (index step).
member.param:
Sampling resolution for calculating contour length.
Distance between two points will be more accurate if the provided value is lower (sampling resolution is higher). The provided value should be fine for most splines.
If the spline is "very curvy" set it to a lower value. To increase performance set it to a higher one (e.g. 1).
Interval [0..1].
member.returns: Indices for which points are evenly distributed.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.ValidIndicesRange(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Gets valid indices range for interpolation.
Valid range is: [MIN_INDEX.. (count-1+MAX_INDEX_OFFSET - epsilon)]

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.AddTensionPoints(System.Collections.Generic.List{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF})
member.summary:
Adds first and last control point so that current border point can be also interpreted as part of a contour.
Those new points will be added as reflected penultimate points over the last (border) control points.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.CardinalSpline.reflectPoint(DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF,DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF)
member.summary: Reflect point over reflector point.

member.summary: Gets cumulative distance for a contour (threated as closed contour).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.ContourExtensions_Point32i.GetClosestPoint(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.Point},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets closest point to the starting from a moving in the . Scale is used to avoid local minima if contour is noisy.
member.param: Point index for which to find the closest point.
Start point from which the search begins.
Search direction. If > 0 then search continues in the positive direction, if < 0 then search is continued toward negative indexes.
A good value is ~15. A specified region will be searched every time to avoid local minima.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.ContourExtensions_Point32i.GetClosestPoint(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.Point},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets closest point to the starting from a moving in the . Scale is used to avoid local minima if contour is noisy.
member.param: Point index for which to find the closest point.
Start point from which the search begins.
Search direction. If > 0 then search continues in the positive direction, if < 0 then search is continued toward negative indexes.
A good value is ~15. A specified region will be searched every time to avoid local minima.
Distance from to returned point index.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.ContourExtensions_Point32i.GetClosestPoint(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.Point},System.Int32,AForge.IntRange,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets closest point to the .
member.param: Point index for which to find the closest point.
Distance from to returned point index.

member.summary: Finds valeys and peaks.
member.param: Filter function where peak or valey is choosen. Angle range can be determined also.
A good value is ~15. A specified amount will be skipped every time to avoid local minima.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.ContourExtensions_Point32i.GetHumps(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.Point},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@)
member.summary:
Finds humps in contour. Hump scale is determined by .
For each peak a closest valley is found. Next for that valley a closet point is found. Those three point make hump.
Hump searching will be successful even when only one peak and one valley are found; it can be successful where peak and valley search against convex hull does not give good results.
Peaks and valleys can be obtained by using .
member.param: Used for . A good value is ~20. A specified region will be searched every time to avoid local minimum.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.ContourExtensions_Point32i.ClusterPoints(System.Collections.Generic.IList{DotImaging.Primitives2D.Point},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Double,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary:
Clusters points. Maximum successive distance between two points is specified by .
Points must be ordered!. Can be useful to group data after is used.
member.param: Cumulative contour distance. If not specified it will be automatically calculated.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.Clustering`1
member.summary: Group matching algorithm for detection region averaging.
member.remarks: This class can be seen as a post-processing filter. Its goal is to group near or contained regions together in order to produce more robust and smooth estimates of the detected regions.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.Clustering`1.#ctor(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new group matcher.
member.param:
Minimum group weight threshold. Group with less than will be discarded.
If the all weights are equal to one, the represents the minimum number of neighbors.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.Clustering`1.MinGroupWeight
member.summary:
Minimum group weight threshold. Group with less than minimum group weight will be discarded.
If the all weights are equal to one, the minimum group weight represents the minimum number of neighbors.

member.summary: Groups detections. All weights are set to one.

member.summary: Groups weighted detections.

member.summary: Transforms 3D point to 2D point using transformation matrix and projection regarding camera position.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.PointTransfromationsExtensions.Transform(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF},System.Single[0:,0:])
member.summary: Transfroms each points in the specified collection according to transformation matrix (3x3).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.Geometry.PointTransfromationsExtensions.Normalize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{DotImaging.Primitives2D.PointF})
member.summary:
Normalizes point cloud to range [-1..1]. Ratios will be preserved.
A bounding rectangle will be determined and then
1) points will be translated for (rect center X, rect center Y)
2) and then rescaled for (1/scale, 1/scale) where scale is max(width, height).

member.returns: The covariance matrix of size: [state x state].

member.summary: Gets the covariance of the matrix (means are calculated internally) See function overloads. Each matrix row represents a state. The result has the size of: [state x state].
member.returns: The covariance matrix of size: [state x state].

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform
member.summary:
AForge Math Library AForge.NET framework http://www.aforgenet.com/framework/
Copyright Andrew Kirillov, 2005-2009 andrew.kirillov@aforgenet.com
FFT idea from Exocortex.DSP library http://www.exocortex.org/dsp/
Copyright Darko Juri darko.juric2@gmail.com The class is taken from http://www.aforgenet.com/framework/ and modified to support parallel execution and optimized (pointers).

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction
member.summary: Fourier transformation direction.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction.Forward
member.summary: Forward direction of Fourier transformation.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction.Backward
member.summary: Backward direction of Fourier transformation.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.FFT(Accord.Extensions.Math.ComplexF[],Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: One dimensional Fast Fourier Transform.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.FFT(Accord.Extensions.Math.ComplexF*,System.Int32,Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: One dimensional Fast Fourier Transform.

para.note: The method accepts array of 2n size only, where n may vary in the [1, 14] range.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.FFT2(Accord.Extensions.Math.ComplexF[0:,0:],Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: Two dimensional Fast Fourier Transform.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.FFT2(Accord.Extensions.Math.ComplexF*,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Accord.Extensions.Math.FourierTransform.Direction)
member.summary: Two dimensional Fast Fourier Transform.

para.note: The method accepts array of 2n size only in each dimension, where n may vary in the [1, 14] range. For example, 16x16 array is valid, but 15x15 is not.

member.summary: Degree resolution.

member.summary: Approximates Atan2 function. Maximum error is 90 / Y_MUL_CONST (1.4 degrees).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathExtensions.Sqrt(System.Single)
member.summary: Approximates Sqrt function. see: http://blog.wouldbetheologian.com/2011/11/fast-approximate-sqrt-method-in-c.html

member.summary: Calculates Jacobian matrix. The size of an Jacobian matrix is [func output length x arg length]
member.param: Evaluation function. arg: starting point returns: function result.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathPowerofTwoExtensions
member.summary: Defined functions can be used as object extensions. Provides additional math functions for integer numbers to check whether they are power of two or not.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathPowerofTwoExtensions.IsPowerOfTwo(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified value is power of 2. It uses fast arithemtics to avoid using: Math.Floor(Math.Log(x, 2))
member.returns: True if the number is power of 2, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathPowerofTwoExtensions.IsPowerOfTwo(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified value is power of 2. It uses fast arithemtics to avoid using: Math.Floor(Math.Log(x, 2))
member.returns: True if the number is power of 2, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathPowerofTwoExtensions.IsPowerOfTwo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified value is power of 2. It uses fast arithmetics to avoid using: Math.Floor(Math.Log(x, 2)).
member.returns: True if the number is power of 2, false otherwise.
member.exception: The specified value must be greater or equal to zero.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathEnumerableExtensions
member.summary:
Provides additional math functions for collections.
Defined functions can be used as object extensions.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Math.MathEnumerableExtensions.WeightedAverage(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Single},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Single})
member.summary:
Calculates weighted average.
In case where sum of weights is equal to zero, zero will be returned. Use a function overload to change this behavior.

member.summary:
Calculates weighted average.
In case where sum of weights is equal to zero, zero will be returned. Use a function overload to change this behavior.

member.summary:
Calculates weighted average.
In case where sum of weights is equal to zero, zero will be returned. Use a function overload to change this behavior.
member.param: Value selector. Parameters are the selected element and index of an element.
Weight selector. Parameters are the selected element and index of an element.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.ForEach``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Immediately executes the given action on each element in the source sequence.
member.typeparam: The type of the elements in the sequence
member.param: The action to execute on each element

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MinBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns the minimal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the minimal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This overload uses the default comparer for the projected type. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current minimal element).
member.param: Selector to use to pick the results to compare
member.returns: The minimal element, according to the projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MinBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``1})
member.summary: Returns the minimal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection and the specified comparer for projected values.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the minimal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This overload uses the default comparer for the projected type. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current minimal element).
member.param: Selector to use to pick the results to compare
Comparer to use to compare projected values
member.returns: The minimal element, according to the projection.
